snippet.title: Sales spike after stars' sad deaths
snippet.content:
LINKIN Park fans have rushed out to buy the band's music in the wake of the death of singer Chester Bennington. Three albums surfaced in the ARIA Top 5 this week, with their 2000 debut Hybrid Theory at No. 2, bumping Ed Sheeran to No. 3, with Lana Del Rey at No.1. The US rock band's latest album One More Light re-entered at No. 4 (it peaked at No. 3 earlier this year), while 2003's Meteora is at No.5. In all 11 Linkin Park albums returned to the Top 100, with fans buying up what stock was left in stores, as well as downloading and streaming the music. Sixteen Linkin Park songs are in this week's ARIA Top 100 singles chart, the highest being In the End at No. 10, with Numb at No. 18 and Heavy, What I've Done, Numb/Encore and One Step Closer all in the Top 50.
News of broke last Thursday - ARIA charts are compiled on Thursday night. His triple platinum debut album re-entered at No. 27, The Gospel Album is No. 66 and Rrakala is at No. 81. Next week's chart will reflect sales from last Friday onwards. Originally published as
